reviews.text: Fabulous museum. 10 lei entry. Lockers available but you need a 0.50 lei coin. Wonderful information on the history of Romania, then there is a Roman section with all the amazing friezes from the Roman column of traian. The treasury with all the gold and jewels is amazing! National costumes on the way out and a gun exhibition on until the end of April. Last tickets at 4.15pm. Need around 1hour.

Small museum with great stuff. We enjoyed the temporary exhibit. We learned a lot about how Romania came to be in it's modern form. The jewelry and sparkly things were awesome. That was only part of the museum not in English.

A great way to spend the day, if you have the time. Several exhibits have fantastic paintings, sculptures and tapestries from all over Europe, with the Romanian historical exhibit displaying a large collection that I'm sure can not be found anywhere else.

I got a bit disappointed. It was not as big as I expected it to be. Surely there has been made a quite amount of effort and the treasure rooms were interesting. Hope that the next time there will be a bigger variety of exhibits.
Very impressed with the exhibits. Surprised there was no mention of the time around 1989. For 10 lei it's a great destination and the souvenir shop is reasonably priced.
Edificio de la Municipalidad de Heredia.
Muy buen trato
Es muy lindo
Edificio bien conservado
Rapida atencion muy buena
This is probably one my favorite museums EVER. Worth the trip. I saw so many interesting things and loved watching the scientists. My entire family had a great time.
Beautifully done revision! The new museum is displaying some exhibits that the old museum couldn't due to lack of space.  Well done, U of M!

super cool place to visit if you are in ann arbor. Budget  friendly. They have everything  from rocks and minerals, dinosaurs, animals, and space exhibits  in such a pretty  building. This is a great stop for a family  day

Update question: will the new museum have a KID friendly plannaterium or will they be just as rude to kids as they always have been? 

We like the museum but the planetarium I want to warn you is NOT kid friendly or shall say the people giving presentations. My 5 year old was completely amazed by it, I wouldn’t have brought him in if he was loud to disrupt anyone, he said ooh wow cool in a normal talking not loud voice because he was amazed by it and the rude guy presenting scolded him twice to be quiet that it’s disruptive and s third time he signaled to my son to zip it again when he was whispering to me to look at something that interested him so my son couldn’t be excited to learn here and couldn’t even whisper.. actually the presenter was louder when scolding my son so he was the one being disruptive. Apparently kids can’t go in and be amazed at what they see or well express it for that matter. It’s not like he was acting up, screaming or throwing a tantrum because I would have walked him out if he was plus he wasn’t continuously talking which we understood plus he understood not to talk when someone else is talking but a quick expression of excitement a couple times from a child is to be expected.  I think this was the worst experience we have had here and won’t be back because of it. Kids can’t be excited to learn here which is sad. Here is a tip, don’t hire people who are not kid friendly. We were sitting closest to the man presenting at the time which is why he was able to hear him at all.  After the show we had a couple other people approach us and complimented how adorable our son was and that it was great as to how amazed he was and how rude the student was giving the presentation. Why is this even acceptable here?

He really has his heart set on working for NASA when he gets big and sure he may change his mind as many and most do but kids shouldn’t have their love for something crushed due to some uptight people. I would love if someone could contact me about this issue.. to make it known this review was noticed by someone at the museum would be little more comforting maybe
There are big windows looking right in to observe the scientists working on huge jaw bones and other skeletons. Very cool! Worth visiting.

The time in Uruguay I spend eating my way throughout the city. 
This place is legit the food was amazing and the service was great could ask for more.
Pasta was good, but there's no bell peppers in ragù.
Not bad. Had beef steaks and they were really good
Buena atención.  Música  en vivo.  Precios algo elevados. Pero un lindo lugar
Un lugar confortable donde poder hacer un alto en el camino y tomar energías.  Muy buena atención
